definition: easily/readily/frequently/at every turn/at the slightest pretext
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
faulted at every turn (idiom); can't get anything right

sentences.english: Fourth, solve problems through consultation on an equal footing, instead of imposing restriction at will.
sentences.chinese: 通过平等协商解决问题，不要动辄设限和制裁。

sentences.english: The two sides should seek consensus on major issues while reserving differences on minor issues, instead of imposing restrictions or sanctions at every turn.
sentences.chinese: 双方应求大同存小异，不要动辄设限和制裁。

sentences.english: Family counselors remind parents not to take what a child says as the gospel truth.
sentences.chinese: 家庭顾问还提醒家长别动辄把孩子的话奉为神旨。

sentences.english: One suet-jade may costs thousands of money or even priceless.
sentences.chinese: 一块羊脂白玉的价值动辄成千上万，甚至价值连城。

sentences.english: Nowadays a lot of startups don't want to raise multi-million dollar series A rounds.
sentences.chinese: 很多初创企业不愿进行动辄上百万的首轮资金筹集。

sentences.english: When seeing our heavy traffic jam at home, I really want to know why this rarely happens in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 看到国内动辄大塞车，很想知道日本咋回事。

sentences.english: Excessive inpatient admissions and length of stay are common problems.
sentences.chinese: 动辄住院和住院过久是常见问题。

sentences.english: She wasn’t so giggly anymore and she had never looked better.
sentences.chinese: 她不再动辄傻笑而且看上去从没有这么完美。

sentences.english: When they grow up they will rebel and become unfilial children.
sentences.chinese: 长大后，自然动辄忤逆反抗，成为一个不孝子。

sentences.english: They may deny responsibility and became moody, volatile or angry.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能推卸责任，变得不快，动辄发脾气。

sentences.english: She's frequently difficult [at odds] with me.

definition: over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
there are plenty of such people
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
